result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Violation - Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer; Bail Jumping-Felony; 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety.  Issuing Agency - Brodhead PD.
May not possess or consume any intoxicants. May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant. May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold. May not operate a motor vehicle at all. Defendant shall within 48 hrs of release complete processing at the Brodhead Police Department.
